column1: Utrechtse Heuvelrug (Dutch pronunciation: [ˌytrɛxtsə ˈɦøːvəlrʏx]; English: Utrecht Hill Ridge) is a municipality in the Netherlands
column2: in the province of Utrecht. It was formed on 1 January 2006 by merging the former municipalities of Amerongen

column1: == Name ==
The name of the municipality is derived from the Utrecht Hill Ridge
column2: a ridge of sandhills that covers part of the province of Utrecht. All the former municipalities that merged into Utrechtse Heuvelrug are situated on the southern part of this ridge. In this southern part lies the Utrechtse Heuvelrug National Park
